snippet: Two United States attorneys traveled to Cambodia this week to see firsthand a temple tied to a 10th-century statue, whose ownership is under contention.
abstract: Lawyers from United States Attorney’s Office in Manhattan travel to Cambodia to inspect ancient temple as part of office’s effort to seize 10th-century Khmer statue that Sotheby’s hopes to sell at auction; unusual trip is latest development in court case between auction house and US officials, who are trying to help Cambodia gain possession of statue it contends was looted from temple during country's civil war.
lead_paragraph: Two United States attorneys traveled to Cambodia this week to see firsthand a temple tied to a 10th-century statue, whose ownership is under contention.

headline.seo: United States Officials Travel to Cambodia in Statue Case
headline.main: Lawyers Go to Cambodia Over Statue
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Go To Cambodia Over Statue
